description_txt: stated on March 2, 2010 in a 'Today Show' interview:
quote_txt: "He (Obama) has done several things well. Most of those things are places where he changed his view from where he had during the campaign. So, for instance, he's left our troops in Iraq and they're being more successful there. He boosted our effort in Afghanistan, which is the right course to take. He did not close Guantanamo, thank heavens."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2010 in a hearing before Congress:
quote_txt: In 2001, former Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan "justified increasing spending and cutting taxes, saying that we didn't really need to pay down the debt."

description_txt: stated on February 26, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: U.S. Rep. Alan Grayson "compared a former vice president to a vampire ... and compared America's health care system to the Holocaust."

description_txt: stated on February 20, 2010 in a statement on his Web site:
quote_txt: Florida "has the second-highest foreclosure rate in the nation."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2010 in an interview with Fox News:
quote_txt: "Charlie Crist was the only prominent Republican in the country to campaign with Barack Obama before the stimulus passed, on behalf of the stimulus."

description_txt: stated on February 28, 2010 in a roundtable segment on NBC's Meet the Press:
quote_txt: "The Republicans have repeatedly said that they agree with 80 percent of what's in our bill."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2010 in the televised health care summit:
quote_txt: The health care bill "dumps 15 to 18 million low-income Americans into a Medicaid program that none of us want to be a part of because 50 percent of doctors won't see new patients."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2010 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: Gov. Rick Perry "spent over a million dollars on D.C. lobbyists asking for more federal money and lives in a luxury house that costs taxpayers $10,000 a month."

description_txt: stated on January 14, 2010 in An interview with Newsmax:
quote_txt: "I left the city with $43 million in the bank."

description_txt: stated on February 19, 2010 in an advertisement:
quote_txt: Challenger Tim Tuggey "is a lobbyist who donated over $41,000 to Democrats who support abortion and same-sex marriage."

description_txt: stated on January 20, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Her opponent: zero times a judge, zero rulings, zero experience on the bench."

description_txt: stated on February 26, 2010 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "I'm glad for the wording of it (an ethics report on corporate-sponsored Congressional trips) because clearly the wording exonerates me."

description_txt: stated on February 22, 2010 in a campaign flier:
quote_txt: Says he "never" donates to Democrats while Paul Workman "contributes to Democrat Kirk Watson and other Democrats running against Republicans."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2010 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: Says Paul Workman "voted in the Democrat primary, supporting Democrats with his vote."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2009 in his campaign Web site:
quote_txt: "Fifty-seven" of  Rubio's 100 ideas "ultimately became law."

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2010 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Speaker Rubio supported gun restrictions that included background checks and waiting periods."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2010 in the televised health care summit:
quote_txt: "The costs for families (in the individual market) for the same type of coverage that they're currently receiving would go down 14 percent to 20 percent."

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2010 in a comment at the president's health care reform summit:
quote_txt: The CBO found that the House Republican health care plan would lower premiums by "up to about 10 percent" and, for purchasers in the individual market, "those cost savings could even be higher."

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2010 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Says one in three Texas children drop out of high school.

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2010 in the televised health care summit:
quote_txt: "Since 1981, reconciliation has been used 21 times. Most of it's been used by Republicans."

description_txt: stated on February 8, 2010 in a TV advertisement.:
quote_txt: "I vetoed more than $3 billion in spending. Lawmakers and I cut taxes for 40,000 small businesses. Now Texas is No. 1 in job creation. The nation’s five best housing markets are right here in Texas. We balanced five state budgets and we cut state spending."

description_txt: stated on February 18, 2010 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: "Congresswoman Bachmann actually said we should be 'weaned' off our Social Security and Medicare. She wants to privatize Social Security and replace Medicare with some kind of voucher system."

description_txt: stated on February 20, 2010 in a speech to Pinellas County Republicans.:
quote_txt: The Democratic health care plan is a "government takeover of our health programs."

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2010 in an advertisement by the Florida Democratic Party:
quote_txt: Bill McCollum "cost the rest of us billions" as a member of Congress, including a national debt that "skyrocketed" to $4.7 trillion.

description_txt: stated on February 24, 2010 in an advertisement by the Florida Democratic Party:
quote_txt: Bill McCollum voted four times to raise his own pay, by a total of $51,000, and earns a congressional pension worth more than $75,000 a year.

description_txt: stated on February 16, 2010 in a comment on her Facebook page.:
quote_txt: "Bill McCollum said tax cuts don't work."

description_txt: stated on February 23, 2010 in a television advertisement:
quote_txt: "As bank president, Alex Sink eliminated thousands of Florida jobs while taking over $8 million in salary and bonuses."

description_txt: stated on February 8, 2010 in his campaign blog:
quote_txt: "Florida leads the nation in elected officials charged with crimes."

description_txt: stated on February 20, 2010 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: "One of the most recent polls said 75 percent of the American people have said either don't do anything or start over (on health care reform)."

description_txt: stated on February 17, 2010 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "We were promised (the stimulus) would provide 'green jobs' for Americans, but 80% of the $2 billion they spent on alternative energy went to purchase wind turbines built in China!"
